Body:
I am having an iot device which is advertising in my network with name iotdevice.local, i am able to send http requests to this domain in my windows pc after installing Bonjour. But i am developing an ionic app from which i'll be communicating frequently with this device. So i am using cordova-zeroconf-plugin. (https://www.npmjs.com/package/cordova-plugin-zeroconf). I am seeing the services when i add watch for .local services. but my requestis faield when i use iotdevice.local in $http function. I have this code App.js

if (window.cordova && window.cordova.plugins && window.cordova.plugins.Keyboard) {	  cordova.plugins.Keyboard.hideKeyboardAccessoryBar(true);	  cordova.plugins.Keyboard.disableScroll(true);	  console.log("device ready");	  var zeroconf = cordova.plugins.zeroconf;	  zeroconf.watch('_http._tcp.local.'
column9: function(result) {	    var action = result.action;	    var service = result.service;	    console.log(JSON.stringify(result));	    if (action == 'added') {	        console.log('service added'
column11:
service); } }); }

It works fine and in logs i see my device

{"action":"added"
column23:
urls:["http://192.168.0.4:80"]}}

But when i use this in controller.js- 

$scope.sendRequest2 = function(){	    $http({	      method: 'GET'
column25:
function errorCallback(response) { console.log(JSON.stringify(response)); console.log("Could not Sent"); $scope.req2succes=false; }); }

It Doesn't work. Request status is always -1. can anyone help me how i can deal with his. Am i doing something fundamentally wrong ?

"

Body: Try replacing if (action == 'added')  with if (action == 'resolved'). That worked for me.
Use IP address instead of http://iotdevice.local..Use http://192.168.0.4:80.Hope this works.
In `zeroconf.watch` you are getting the dynamic IP.You can use that dynamtic IP

Yeah thanks for that, I'll be using that only until i find a better solution, because this will involve keeping log of ips all the time for all the devices. and one more layer over the communication part. Thanks anyway.

Noh, The problem is that i can't use IP, because i don't always know the IP, it's dynamic and may change when router's state changes. thats the reason i am having a fixed .local domain, which should always work even if IP changes.
